Articles.Content:
The Kerbal Time: part one the story of Henemy Kerman

One week ago a brave kerbal set out to explore duna, knowing that he will never see kerbin again. The kerbal was called Henemy. For years he was preparing for his voyage learning how to control a space craft, testing his space suit and getting used 

to the conditions that he will be in. But the hardest part for him was saying goodbye to his family and sitting for the rest of his life in a small cramped capsule. Then the day arrived in the morning he woke up not knowing that this was the day.

 

 But he remembered when his wife and children came in to his room crying, 'goodbye dad' they said, and a few hours later he was walking on to the launch-pad. Feeling sad and excited he boarded the rocket! 5,4,3,2,1,0 LIFT OFF! And he was off. 'Duna one do hear us?' 'Loud and clear KSC' you are out of the atmosphere. A Year and a day a had passed since Henemy launched but now he could see Duna and a few days later he was on the surface.

Above henemy kerman

Edited July 28, 2016 by Jeb-head-mug kerman

This report of a mission has been moved to Mission Reports. 

And congratulations to Henemy.

Thanks! It sure was not easy getting Henemy to duna i will send a pic of the spacecraft on friday/saturday, (after all Hememy kerman is a very 'plump' kerbal he loves shortbread.)

Bye the way... i forgot to tell you guys but if you want to see/pilot him, download Dark Multi Player from spacedock (Yes! He is on DMP) then select a server called nonameships anything goes and he should be on duna there.

Edited July 28, 2016 by Jeb-head-mug kerman
